KnowledgeBase.Title: isCharacter
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes:
Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector
FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory
Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean

Function.Description: The isCharacter function checks the argument to determine if it is a Character object.

Brief.Overview: The isCharacter function checks the argument {obj} to determine if it is a Character object. If the object is a Character, the isCharacter function returns true. If the object is not a Character, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isCharacter function is used whenever it is necessary to determine if an object is a Character.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory,
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Boolean

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the object is a Character, otherwise false is returned.
